history.content:
It shouldn't. For example, Phil 12A (Intro to Logic) was approved for Fall 2016 and prior semesters but it isn't anymore, so if you'd taken it then when it was approved, you should be fine! As for your 2nd question, have no idea, perhaps someone else can weigh in about L&S.

These are questions you should direct at the L&S department.

It shouldn't. For example, Phil 12A (Intro to Logic) was approved for Fall 2016 and prior semesters but it isn't anymore, so if you'd taken it then when it was approved, you should be fine! As for your 2nd question, have no idea, perhaps someone else can weigh in about L&S.

If you took a class that was approved during the semester in which you took it, your requirement will be satisfied. You should not take a class from the  "prior to fall 2016" list after fall 2016. https://ls.berkeley.edu/seven-course-breadth-requirement

I've noticed some breadth courses that used to be approved for a particular breadth and semester are now not on the approved list, i.e. a class that was once approved for something like Philosophy & Values for Fall 2016 is now not approved for that same semester. Will this affect graduation if we already took that class during a semester it was approved? Also, why would L&S change the approval status of a class after the semester in question and after students have taken it already presumably to fulfill that requirement?
history.subject: Breadth courses changed?
